trans-unit.source: Provides methods used to render a group box control with or without visual styles.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBoxRenderer> class provides a set of `static` methods that can be used to render a group box control.
Rendering a control refers to drawing the user interface of a control.
To draw a group box, use one of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBoxRenderer.DrawGroupBox%2A> methods.
These methods provide a variety of text drawing options.

If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBoxRenderer.DrawGroupBox%2A> will draw the group box with the current visual style.
Otherwise, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBoxRenderer.DrawGroupBox%2A> will draw the group box with the classic Windows style.
This is useful if you are drawing a custom control that should automatically match the current visual style setting of the operating system.

This class wraps the functionality of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer?displayProperty=fullName> that is set to one of the elements exposed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Button.GroupBox?displayProperty=fullName> class.
For more information, see [Rendering Controls with Visual Styles](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/rendering-controls-with-visual-styles.md).
Draws a group box control in the specified state and bounds.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the group box with the current visual style.
Otherwise, this method will draw the group box with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the group box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the group box.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.GroupBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the group box.
Draws a group box control in the specified state and bounds, with the specified text and font.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the group box with the current visual style.
Otherwise, this method will draw the group box with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the group box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the group box.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> to draw with the group box.
The to apply to groupBoxText.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.GroupBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the group box.
Draws a group box control in the specified state and bounds, with the specified text, font, and color.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the group box with the current visual style.
Otherwise, this method will draw the group box with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the group box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the group box.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> to draw with the group box.
The to apply to groupBoxText.
The to apply to groupBoxText.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.GroupBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the group box.
Draws a group box control in the specified state and bounds, with the specified text, font, and text formatting.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the group box with the current visual style.
Otherwise, this method will draw the group box with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the group box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the group box.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> to draw with the group box.
The to apply to groupBoxText.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags"></xref> values.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.GroupBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the group box.
Draws a group box control in the specified state and bounds, with the specified text, font, color, and text formatting.
If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the current application, this method will draw the group box with the current visual style.
Otherwise, this method will draw the group box with the classic Windows style.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the group box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the group box.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> to draw with the group box.
The to apply to groupBoxText.
The to apply to groupBoxText.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags"></xref> values.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.GroupBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the group box.
Draws the background of a control's parent in the specified area.
The used to draw the background of the parent of childControl.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> in which to draw the parent control's background.
This rectangle should be inside the child controlâ€™s bounds.
The control whose parent's background will be drawn.
Indicates whether the background of the group box has any semitransparent or alpha-blended pieces.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.GroupBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the group box.
`true` if the background of the group box has semitransparent or alpha-blended pieces; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the renderer uses the application state to determine rendering style.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBoxRenderer.RenderMatchingApplicationState%2A> is `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBoxRenderer> uses the setting from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.RenderWithVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to determine the rendering style.
If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GroupBoxRenderer.RenderMatchingApplicationState%2A> is `false`, the renderer will always render using visual styles.
`true` if the application state is used to determine rendering style; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
